website_summaries.verdict: Highly effective for dry areas and can even mulch leaves.
pros: We love that this machine operates on 10 speeds and comes with a bag that holds vacuum debris
High marks for power and ease of use, even for beginners
Multiple speeds  of up to 185 mph allow for flexible cleaning
Powerful enough to handle wet and dry leaves

customer_reviews.title: A real lemon
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but trouble with this product. I bought it primarily to vacuum up leaves. I used it once for that purpose and it worked ok, but the battery ran out after 10 minutes. Any attempts to use it after that first time have led to the on/off button not operating which meant a trip to the nearest authorized dealer or not having sufficient power to suck up any leaves. The power button is now broken for the second time.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Died after about 3 uses, probably due to finicky iterlocks
customer_reviews.text: I am amending a previous "meh" review. I didn't use this much last year, and the warranty has now expired. But, on about the third use I got the famous "beeping" problem - that is, when I push the on button it beeps but doesn't start. If you Google this you'll find this is a very common complaint. There is a link to another review below that explains one possible fix for it, but I played with all the interlocks and it didn't work for me. It is going in the trash and I'll buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: LMc

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it didn't on day 2
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly powerful and quick to charge. Bought for the mulching/vacuum function. Impressive, had to be careful not to suck up the numerous small rocks that result from edging the walks and driveway. Leaves can jam where the pick up tubes narrow down and join. Used Saturday afternoon about 15 minutes and then Saturday evening about 10 more minutes no problem. Used about 10 minutes Sunday afternoon fine. At 7 Sunday evening it worked fine for @ 5 minutes and would stop. Would start back and run a minute or two. Gonna return and try a different unit
customer_reviews.author: BoxBoy

customer_reviews.title: Marginal performance and poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: Less than average performance even at 185 mph. I had this for a couple of months and the blower motor became sluggish even at full charge. Called Customer Service and they were not cooperative and Amazon agreed with my view of Greenworks support. Although the cordless concept is convenient it is not worth the hassle for an inferior product with Inferior Customer Support. I also bought a pole chain saw from them with marginal performance at best with the bar kicking off the chain frequently. The bottom line is I would think twice before ordering their products.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ashihara

customer_reviews.title: Avoid greenworks products
customer_reviews.text: Avoid. Works decent as a blower and mediocre as a vac. However it is one of the few cordless leaf vacs on the market. The problem is the mulch bag gets a decent bit of wear and if it gets damaged it is not possible to ordera replacement bag. At this point i regret buying this item and getting into the greenworks products. I now have two batteries and a blower without a vacuum bag and i cant use it for the original reason it was purchaed. This isnt a company or product line you want to be involved with. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: KungFuGrip

customer_reviews.title: From gas to battery - AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: This product truly deserves some kudos, i was leery at first about going from gas power to battery but it’s a move that made myself pretty proud, very light weight and just as powerful, 40v is the key. Even vacuumed up the wet oak leaves and mulched them up great. One huge thing was the ease of removing and replacing the attachments. I’ve had it about six months now. The blowing capability is fantastic, I like that I can control the amount of wind. The only thing I would suggest is to get an additional battery. Love this product
customer_reviews.author: Christian L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: customer service not very good after purcahse
customer_reviews.text: After using my new green works leaf blower i tried it as a leaf vacuum the bag zipper ripped at the bottom this after only using it a 2-3 times called customer service they asked me to send them the proof of purchase from amazon and they would send me a new one i did. it's been several months now and nothing so today i called customer service and they advised they never received the information i know the information went through as it was not returned what a run around now they want all the information again then next they will tell me it's no longer in warranty
customer_reviews.author: jan fuente

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Based on the rave reviews, I had thought I would be super happy with this purchase only to end up super disappointed. I ended up sending this back because the battery would not hold a charge more than 60 minutes like it was supposed to. Beyond that issue though, it is very heavy to use and difficult to switch out the parts to go from blowing to mulching. And the mulching process leaves a fine dust spewing out everywhere which should not be expected for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Blower
customer_reviews.text: I like Greenworks line of battery powered tools to start with. This item didn't really disappoint. I didn't expect it to rival the blowing capability of a gas or electric model. It isn't as forceful for sure, but what I like about these tools is their portability, maneuverability and light weight. This model fills that bill perfectly. It is good for medium duty. The turbo mode does kick it into high speed which comes close to an electric or smaller gas model. However, in turbo mode it will consume the battery much faster. Always keep a spare battery in the charger ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Battery died in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, strong leaf blower, not a very good leaf vacuum (if a pile of leaves is even slightly wet this will struggle to pick them up), but the main problem is the battery died in under 1 year, this should be covered under warranty, but Greenworks is using the COVID-19 excuse to not answer their emails anymore even though we've sent three over the course of three weeks. I was thinking of buying other Greenworks products (chainsaw, weed whacker), but not until you replace the dead battery in your warranty! Answer your emails!
customer_reviews.author: Pete R.

customer_reviews.title: Kept turning off
customer_reviews.text: I have a greenworks chainsaw and two 40v batteries for it. That works pretty well. The blower I received was defective from the start. Either something with the battery connection or the started button. It would turn on and run for a few second or a minute at most, then shut down. I tested with both fully charged batteries. Both batteries worked fine when switched back to the chainsaw. Ended up making a return request a few hours after receiving it. For the amount of work I need to do I think I trust a more reliable gas blower.
customer_reviews.author: S.P.

customer_reviews.title: Works well and worth it
customer_reviews.text: Really does work well, although the battery doesn't last all that long. Maybe 30-40 min at full strength. Blower is nice and powerful; sucking up leaves (oak) was a snap and I was actually impressed by the performance. I had read some reviews so my expectations weren't all that high; really did the job though. My only complaint and why I didn't give this five stars is because when I put the battery on the charger the lights indicate fully charged. When you leave it on there it changes to charging indicators but it takes a while for that to happen; something quirky with the indicators but the battery is charging and doesn't seem to be bad.
customer_reviews.author: Bosch

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 40V 185 MPH Variable Speed Cordless Blower Vacuum
customer_reviews.text: I have several Greenworks 40V products and I use this one plenty year round: from light snow cleaning, to leaf management, to debris pickup after storms (mostly small tree branches and leaves). converting between blower and vac mode is not difficult, takes under 5 minutes, it is faster going from vac to blower. I mostly use it in blower mode, and it is more than adequate in both battery life and wind power. vac mode is real useful for picking up the leaves that are in corners that no blower angle seems to be able to push out of the corner... the grind up feature is also pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It really sucks, and blows too
customer_reviews.text: Man this thing really sucks, I couldn't be happier. Works well removing leaves from our rock garden. You can gently (or not) press it into the bed of stones to jostle and suck loose even buried leaves. Works well in the yard, works well on the deck. Blows too, but I don't under stand the appeal of blower. I'd prefer to suck up the rubbish in a convenient bag for the garbage man. The bag attachment is not dirt-tight. If you suck up dirt, there's a good change it will blow through the bag and cover everything with a nice layer of dirt dust. I suppose that could be blown into a corner to be swept up.
customer_reviews.author: John the Leprechaun

customer_reviews.title: Light & Manueverable
customer_reviews.text: First of all it works great! It’s fairly light, with most of the weight being due to the battery. And no more extension cords to drag around, catch on everything in the area, and getting a leg tangled up in. And that doesn’t consider the danger of wandering into wet areas while dragging along 110 volts. And then there’s the irritation of running out of extension cord before reaching property borders. I wish this had been available 30 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Bilgewater

customer_reviews.title: Battery life not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Before you spend $200+ you must understand the battery supplied with this blower/vacuum will only last 15-20 min. if you use it until the battery runs dead. The battery will overheat and will not accept a charge for a least 1 hour, then it take nearly two hours to recharge. For a battery that cost around $120., that will only power the machine in blower mode for less than 20 mins. and far less {10-12 mins) in vacuum mode is really disappointing. RECOMMENDED FOR VERY SMALL, QUICK JOBS ONLY! Any thing else you might be disappointed also.
customer_reviews.author: Udarkness

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great for light jobs like clearing the gutters or cleaning up. It really shines when fighting fascists who toss tear gas on peaceful protests too. Seriously, f those guys.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Diamond

customer_reviews.title: Read this review first
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to suck up and mulch leaves. It does that. My only complaint is that the dust from the mulched leaves coming from the bag is BAD. I get coated with the dust. I find myself wrestling with the unit when I have the bag strap draped over my shoulder. Finally, the two power settings are a bit confusing. I haven't used it to blow leaves but the motor is strong so I'm sure it will do a good job.
customer_reviews.author: M. Russo

customer_reviews.title: Biggest disappointment in anything I've ever bought through Amazon...
customer_reviews.text: ...and I'm a regular Amazon customer and have been for years. As a vacuum, this is almost a total failure. I can't believe how little power it has. Previously I had to worry about an electric leaf vac I had which would pick up gravel-sized stones. I have trouble getting this product to pick up desiccated leaves. I could suck up more leaves with a soda straw. For me, this was a wasted almost-$200. This will end up in the trash next pickup.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent T. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: As a leaf blower , this blower is great, as a vacuum, it has some issues.
customer_reviews.text: During use as a blower, the brushless, variable speed motor allows tight control of the debris being blown. The lowest speeds allows debris to be blown into a pile for easy collection. Use as a vacuum is somewhat cumbersome due to the way the device is configured in this mode. In addition, while vacuuming, depending on the material being collected, excessive dust may be emitted from the collection bag, requiring the use of a face mask to protect your lungs.
customer_reviews.author: neilth

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product without support
customer_reviews.text: This machine is absolute junk!!! I used it for 5 min and the machine stopped working. I repeatedly receive several beeps that are not addressed in the manual. I tried emailing & calling customer support with no response. I feel the sold me an inferior product & do not have anyone to support their product. I will NEVER buy a product from this company again. Thanks for taking my money & not supported your supposed 4 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Ammr

customer_reviews.title: First one didn't work and neither does the replacement
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered stopped working within 2 days. Requested a replacement which worked a little longer (3 weeks) then started doing the same thing as the first one. The leaf blower just beeps and the lights flash. I've recharged the batteries, open the door and checked the impeller, take the battery off and on, nothing works. It runs for a few seconds then just stops and beeps. Junk! My replacement window was June 3rd it is now June 7th so I am out of luck. Should have just returned the first one and not bothered with a second chance on the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Smith

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in first use!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how anyone could give less than 5 stars for this bad-boy! I just cleaned my entire property with this in like 30 minutes. Very powerful, and not too noisy. Easy to carry/maneuver and it just works perfectly. Less expensive than comparable units and it has the vacuum feature too! What more could you ask for. Battery did not weaken in the 30 mins I used it on max speed! Hopin this lasts at least a few years...highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Mickus

customer_reviews.title: Wow, this thing has some power -love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have lots of leaves and small limbs in the back and its not on a flat hard surface. I have 2 other battery models and an electric unit. I tested it yesterday and was impressed. Plenty of power, even in back on the grass etc. Then I realized I was not in the upper power range. It has even more power. Thus: WOW.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: If you like purchasing something that doesn't work. This is the product for you...
customer_reviews.text: It's spring time to cleanup the yard... The vacuum partially worked for the first 2 hours but then started blowing leaves away rather than mulching. DO NOT BUY!!! I purchased this item in November and left it in the original unopened box until today. Worst mistake but it is hard to test a leaf blower/vacuum during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This worked great..
customer_reviews.text: This worked great.... for a few hours. Eventually, the manufacturer sent me a replacement blower unit. It worked great.... for a few hours. It seems the switch is very prone to failure. Other reviewers have had the same experience. This is a very high price for something that fails so quickly. The compounding problem is that I bought this in January to prepare for spring cleanup, and so the first time I used it was outside of the normal return window. Save yourself some time and just light $170 on fire. It will be more amusing.
customer_reviews.author: John Martin

customer_reviews.title: This thing blows! It might also suck. To be continued...
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Blower mode lasted ~20 minutes at 4.5 power (Medium-high). Enough to clear 100ft of gravel drive covered in moderate leaves & grass clippings. Some time was lost as I became accustomed to the unit. I have not tried leaf sucker mode yet. Very easy to put together right out of the box. Cleverly built: 1) Attach blower tube to front with optional extender to blow. Good battery placement provides excellent balance for one-hand use. 2) Attach 2 pieces to the bottom & the bag to the front for vacuum mode. Comfortable hand grips and bag shoulder strap.
customer_reviews.author: Traynor

customer_reviews.title: On-off membrane switch failed
customer_reviews.text: After less than two years of use, I can no longer turn the blower on unless I depress the membrane switch with a screwdriver, and I have to turn it off by removing the battery. If I leave the battery in the unit, it sometimes turns on by itself due to the intermittent power switch. I've now purchased two Greenworks products (the other was a chainsaw that spewed bar oil, and the chain wouldn't stay tensioned) with poor performance. Wouldn't buy any of their products again.
customer_reviews.author: Lima

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT suck. (And in this case that’s a BAD thing!)
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for cleaning up madrone leaves, but quickly returned it. As a blower it’s very good, but also very heavy. I prefer the lighter Worx blower, even though that means switching batteries more often. But as a mulcher, it does NOT suck very well unless the leaves are on a hard surface and worst of all, if you use the collection bag you will soon be covered in filthy dust. There are many ways to get dirty for a lot less money.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Ekins

customer_reviews.title: The battery design is terrible
customer_reviews.text: The blower is a good product. It's the battery that makes me wish I would have bought a different brand. The battery release clip is designed for dainty little hands. The release is especially hard to release after a few months of use. It is also hard to release after you've been working hard in the yard and your hands are sweaty. You almost need to go ask your wife, "Honey, can you release the battery from the blower, please?"
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: I love Greenworks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago and was doing yard work when I sat it down and picked up and it stopped working for some reason. I charged the battery thinking it was the issue and it still wouldn't work. I called Greenworks explaining what happened, the guy asked for my info and is sending a new one for free no questions asked. The customer service was so great I would definitely buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has good power for blowing, but drains small battery fast
customer_reviews.text: Good power for blowing leaves, haven’t used vacuum yet. I purchased just the unit not including the battery cause I have two other Greenworks products, that came with batteries. This blower sucks battery juice real good too (reason for four stars), it takes my two batteries for larger cleanups. So if your doing more than just blowing grass clippings from your driveway and walks, I would advise getting the larger battery. I’m still shopping the larger battery and will update if that doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: R. Black

customer_reviews.title: No customer support
customer_reviews.text: This company changed the internal design of the battery but did not change the par number. To but a replacement you must know if your blower is a Gen 1 or Gen 2 version. Nothing is provided in the manual that addresses this. I've called the manufacturer several times but no one ever answers the phone and you get overwhelmed with product offers for dozens of unrelated products. I've emailed them more than once and have never received a reply. I would never buy any more products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Thurston

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery and charger. Power declines quickly and it becomes a garage decoration.
customer_reviews.text: You will lose power within a 2 months. The battery charged fully for about 5 weeks, and now only partially charges no matter how long it’s on the base. I can’t even blow off my driveway without it completely dying before I finish! I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Alisia

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum blower
customer_reviews.text: I brought this because had rate rating and went with the bigger battery, the battery is shit, wont stay charged, and after is fully charge will only run 10 mins then it dead and have to re charge, for the money do not buy, not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie.West

customer_reviews.title: 40V 4 amp battery will get 20 tp 30 Minutes on high speed
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a Husqvarna BT 150 back. pack blower because of the weight. This unit does not have the power of the Husqvarna. I had to use 8 battery charges (max 20 minutes each charge) to do the same work and then use 10 wheelbarrow loads to remove the leaves. The vacuum is not strong enough to pick up wet leaves. Having said all this, I still like the unit because of light weight and it's easy to maneuver. I just need to allot more time to do the same work.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: I love it. It mulches like a boss
customer_reviews.text: The batteries are phenomenal! I used four times already on my fall leaves. Four times you wonder...because my neighbors' trees don't (shed?) all at the same time. I love it. It mulches like a boss! and NO CORDS!! Although a full battery does last over 30mins on high suction (6) It is recommended to get a backup, for those bigger jobs. The bag is a bit difficult at times when you are trying to maneuver around landscaping. At times leaves will stick in the vacuum tube. It sure beats raking and blowing leaves into bags that fill too fast. Great for adding to compost bins!! Happy Mulching!
customer_reviews.author: Rogue

customer_reviews.title: Blower is a piece of trash!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of crap! I have not used it for more than a total time of 2 hours since I received it and the battery that came with it and the extra battery that I purchased only last about five to ten seconds and yes I do mean seconds! I’m going to see if there’s any way that I can get my money back on this! I definitely would never buy this again even if they only wanted fifty dollars for it! John Henry Jones johnhenryjones926@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: John Henry J

customer_reviews.title: Not enough power for the dollars, returned
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, nice package/bundle. However, Husband advised was nearly useless for our leaves... Not enough power for the job. Great bundle but didn't seem sufficient. Didn't bother using the attractive suction and bag because he was too unhappy with the lack of leaf movement. May work better for smaller jobs/yards and dry leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery charge adequate for home property for blowing, not quite for vacuuming all at one time.
customer_reviews.text: I liked it all. Have gotten a lot of good use from it. To vacuum the whole suburban home grounds all at the same time a second battery would be handy. Otherwise very happy with it and recommend it highly. (The box also contained several attachments for some other device. Drove me nuts at first trying to hook them up until the local handyman figured out that they had nothing to do with this device. So somebody else received their device lacking those parts. Not my problem.)
customer_reviews.author: 78RPM

customer_reviews.title: Best leaf/grass/dirt blower ever!
customer_reviews.text: No gas, oil or hassle with starting. No prime prime prime prime, pull pull pull pull, prime, pull pull ... One batter gives enough charge to blow heavy lots of leafs from 1/8 acre front yard. Also extremely handy for blowing off patio, blowing out gutters, cleaning sidewalk and drive after cutting grass. So easy to use, you will find a hundred uses! Now after each lawn cutting I blow off the sidewalks and drive as well as the edge troughs for a nice manicured look to lawn. Gas blower was just too much hassle for such little projects, but with this, why not?
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca or Michael Parmley

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and makes a mess.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, even the lithium ion battery is heavy. The unit “dusts” excessively in the vacuum mode. Small mulched bits of debris leak out of the connections making you dirty while you vacuum. And the fitment is tight and to spec. There’s got to be better alternatives. The battery doesn't last very long in the vacuum mode, anything who thinks a battery powered unit could replace a gas powered one is delusional. I would also prefer that the opening intake for the vacuum be smaller as well.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning user

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $$
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace corded machine. Just as heavy as old one and not much more maneuverabity. The blower works adequately the vacuum has no power. Will not pick up clipped grasses from plant beds, even at high power level. Not at all what I expected. I would send back, but have thrown away the packaging (my bad). I would not recommend this, especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: jas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Blower!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blower for my husband because the gas engine blower he had was WAY too heavy ... and STINKY! This blower is very light, easy to use one-handed, is perfect for blowing leaves off the deck and patio. The battery is easy to charge and lasts a long time, maybe 3 hours? It charges quickly. It is simple to put in the blower and also to put in the charger unit. Can't say enough good things about this blower! It blew me away! :)
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Robin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed...
customer_reviews.text: I own several GreenWorks cordless G-Max products and they work fine for my small yard/lawn. Unfortunately, the latest addition of this blower/vac is a disappointment. First, it drains batteries faster than any other tool even in lower speed setting. Second, as a vacuum/mulcher it clogs very often because of a wire that goes inside the exhaust and needs cleaning every several minutes. As for the performance, it is OK in both modes as long as it keeps operating which is not for long for the reasons I've mentioned. The bottom line is: OK as a blower with enough spare batteries; unusable as a vac/mulcher without certain design changes.
customer_reviews.author: SVB

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! No customer support.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit a little over a year ago. When I first got it, the blower worked well and battery was strong. Today, the battery will not hold a charge and essentially is junk. Too expensive to replace battery. Contacted customer service to see if they could help me out with their product. They wouldn't offer anything, not a replacement battery nor a discount to purchase one. For this kind of money I would expect the unit to last and not be a throw-away. Alas, with lousy customer support, I will NEVER purchase nor would I recommend any product from Greenworks. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lee

customer_reviews.title: battery only lasts 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to see that Greenworks offered a vac/blower as I purchased their hedge trimmer and chain saw earlier this summer and have had a great experience with both items including the battery life. I tried this blower/vac two times and both times the battery only lasted 10 minutes and that was with a fully charged battery. Now I get to hand rake all of my leaves this weekend...not very happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: TKE

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work for us. Returned the first one because we thought it was defective. Whether using the blower or vac, it would shut off after a few seconds and start beeping. Different code every time; sometimes 4, sometimes, 5, sometimes 7. Did all the troubleshooting procedures and nothing. Got the replacement and it did the same thing. Couldn’t even suck up one dry leaf at a time without shutting off and beeping at me. It is light, easy to use, and looks nice, but doesn’t actually function as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Krampe

customer_reviews.title: You want it to suck but it doesn’t. That’s bad!
customer_reviews.text: I expected a lot more out of this as a blower and especially as a vacuum. There is not a lot of power, the battery dies and when using as a vacuum you end up being fully covered in dust. You could not tell me aspart from the dirt.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't hold the gas powered trimmers so I shopped around for the high MPH speed and battery operated. I love this unit, it is so light and easy to use and hold. The batter lasts quite a while I have never fully drained it after using it on my driveway and deck after mowing. I hope I feel the same when its leaf blowing season! I'm very happy with it. I hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would be a cool vacuum tool for leaves. It's awful. Doesn't suck anything and when it does, they all get clogged up in the tunnel chute before they even get chopped. Live in the PNW, so the leaves are fairly big, but not gigantic where I am. The blower capability isn't bad, which is the mean function. However, it sure uses up a battery quick. If I were to mow my tiny yard, weed whack and blow, the battery wouldn't make it. Very tiny yard again. I can mow in about 8 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: FilmComposer

customer_reviews.title: Good blower but the bag is poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Effective blower - but you will probably need a second battery to get any extensive weekend work done. Leaf vacuum works well but the bag DOES NOT! After one season of use the material wore through. Zipper looks like it is made of light weight plastic and is not suitable for outdoor use. As soon as the bag wore through the zipper separated and was no longer functional.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Support for broken tools
customer_reviews.text: I have three Greenworks tools that were all working great but my leaf blower randomly just stopped working a couple months ago. I have attempted to contact via email twice within 6 weeks with no response. I have tried calling them several times and when I was on hold no one ever answered. I just tried calling again and after hitting '1' for English it actually disconnects so now you can't even wait on hold. I've even tried tweeting at them on Twitter with no response. So I guess I will need to buy a new leaf blower which sucks especially since all my tools use the same battery but I'm definitely not buying a Greenworks tools again.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Mettler

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy. Go with ryobi instead.
customer_reviews.text: The battery died after first use and won’t recharge. Ten days past the return date so I have to file a warranty claim. It also doesn’t have a narrow attachment for vacuuming so the suction power and precision is terrible. Don’t get stuck with a subpar product. There are better products out there that won’t break after the first use. Ryobi for one. Greenworks would only replace the battery and not the battery and charger. Amazon was great. But buy Ryobi instead.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Zipper torn on the bag during 1st  use.
customer_reviews.text: The zipper unzipped from the backside before the bag was 1/4 full on the 2nd use. Made a mess all over my lawn. They were unable to send me just a new bag, so Amazon customer service suggested they give me a $20 voucher that I can go to my local hardware store with and see if they sell a bag that fits. What a joke!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool and customer care
customer_reviews.text: I own several of these and have loved their performance for my commercial business. The only problem I've had is that the on/off button wears out after depressing it as often as we do. It's still a great value, but maybe a different design for the on/off switch would be better...like the switch used on the corded version. Fyi, I called the company about the issue and instead of saying they were sorry and sending me replacement switches, they sent me 2 new blower/vacs! I didnt ask for that, they just sent them. Unbelievable customer care!
customer_reviews.author: E.A. Maznio

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I am a 57 year old female and it's not too heavy for me. Power pack needs a bit of muscle to pull on or off but I can manage. I had another one with electric cord that I hated - and it just didn't manage well (design was that I had to keep my arm up the whole time and the catch bag set up was awkward). Not so with this one - design is great with easy use. I just swing my arm and hold it. Love that it has power levels.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Kay

customer_reviews.title: Good power foe a cordless
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily for paved areas and fake grass. It has plenty of bower for this. It has a turbo boost but I rarely have to use it. Takes me about twenty minutes to do my area, battery life is very good. I have never run out of power. Battery charges fast. Have used it entire summer with no issues. It also has a leaf vac. which I have yet to try. The controls are well placed and easy to use with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Tough on leaves, battery discharges fast.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Greenworks tool and as with the other two I am quite happy with it. It blows enough air to clean up the leaves in my yard faster than a rake and the shredder function is great for packing a lot more leaves in each bag. It's also much easier than scooping them up with hands or a rake to get them in a bag. The only points off are for battery life, it burns through a battery pretty quick so make sure you get an extra. (I have four)
customer_reviews.author: Tom in MN

customer_reviews.title: Good Performance, Just Did Not Last
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this blower vacuum for the five minutes or so that it stayed functional. It had great power. But, the battery would not hold after about five minutes. I called and was sent a new battery. I looked forward to receiving the new battery because I really liked the performance of the blower vacuum when it was working. Even with a new battery the machine would not work after about five minutes. Returned machine.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: For a battery powered blower I am satisfied with this aspect
customer_reviews.text: For a battery powered blower I am satisfied with this aspect. Although I believe if the small nozzle attachment was permanently attached it would perform better. I have to continually pull this piece to make sure it is snug or the air flows around it and minimizes blowing power. As a leaf vacuum/mulcher I am beyond disappointed. I purchased to pick up magnolia leaves and it does not do the job. It takes forever to pick up only a few leaves and before the bag is full, the leaves are backing up thru the nozzle. Very annoying and time consuming. Considering returning and purchasing 2 separate products instead of the combined unit.
customer_reviews.author: Doitmyselfer

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum/mulch function very weak.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because my EGO blower, which is excellent, doesn't have a vacuum/mulch function. This one has a 40 volt battery as opposed to 56 volt on the EGO. It is much weaker than the EGO and in the vacuum/mulcher is so weak it is not really useful. Don't expect to vacuum up large piles of leaves as in the photo on the website without spending a lot of time on it. For vaccum/mulching, stick with a plug-in model. For blowing, unless you only have small tasks, I would definitely buy the EGO, which has 40% more voltage. The difference in actual blowing is huge.
customer_reviews.author: C. Plaut

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed with the Mulcher Aspect of It!!
customer_reviews.text: When I use the mulcher the dust particles that get through the bag are so large and coarse. Myself, my patio, my windows were completely covered that I had to hose everything down including myself. I own an electric one from Black and Decker and yes dust must come out from the bag, but it is not to the extent to what escapes the Greenworks bag. I did contact them and they say that it is normal, so the air bag can breathe. Next time I use it I will take pictures to show everybody how course that the dust is.
customer_reviews.author: Serpico

customer_reviews.title: Nice but could use some changes and drains battery quickly
customer_reviews.text: Works well, love the interchangeable use for the battery and the other tools. The blower has good power just drains the battery quickly, especially compared to other tools with the same battery and time length. In terms of power, is strong, just doesn’t have a lot of surface area while trying to blow leaves, wish it had several different head to spread out the wind (air).
customer_reviews.author: Daddy, Mama, Mila, & Baby Jake

customer_reviews.title: This works pretty well. I love how quiet it is
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well. I love how quiet it is. It's done well by me as a leaf blower, but I'm let down by the mulching feature. it just doesn't like to pick up many leaves and the chute jams often. I've used that once and most likely won't ever bother again. As a blower, its been strong enough to do what I need to do with it. I've used it to blow gravel off my driveway (from the winter), leaves and debris from the garage, help dry my outdoor patio floor after cleaning it, getting grass and such out from my riding mower,etc.
customer_reviews.author: scatterbrn

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, worked great the first summer we used it. And the second summer. Third summer, the batteries lit up like they're charged, but the thing won't start. We have a yard service, so the blower has gotten very little use. Just to get leaves off lawn furniture for entertaining and things like that. Past warranty, so new battery is $116? For a $169 product? The only reason it's still taking up space in the garage is guilt over putting such a large item in a landfill and uncertainty as to what parts can go in the recycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is the best blower I have ever used. It sure gets the job done right. I like that it isn't so heavy and it doesn't require gas to run, or that it doesn't use a cord that would constantly have to be moved during use. Have used many different blowers, but none compare with this one. The variable speed is great!
customer_reviews.author: chazmo44

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tools, work as described
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Greenworks 12" chainsaw and/or this blower since 2013. Excellent tools, work as described. But the battery is so difficult to remove from the tool and from the charger, I'll never buy another. I have to use two hands, sometimes pound it on the floor, sometimes lock the chainsaw in a vice, and struggle with two hands to remove the battery. Just bought a DeWalt hedge trimmer; just press a button on the tool: it pops out. On the charger, it is not latched in: drop it in and pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: De

customer_reviews.title: The battery drains quickly with the vacuum feature
customer_reviews.text: So for basic blowing it does the job...light snow as well. However with the vacuum feature the battery drains in a hurry! I would buy it for blowing but NOT for vacuuming. We ended up using our air compressor and hoses hooked together to blow out the leaves then sucked them all up with the lawnmower. That really cut our time down!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sue W

customer_reviews.title: Great for old people and small jobs
customer_reviews.text: If you have a small amount of work to do, it does a good job .. If you have a bigger job, you need about three batteries. I have several Greenworks tools, so batteries are not a problem for me. After use, you have to let the battery cool off for about an hour before you charge it. This blower runs about 20 minutes at the fastest speed and makes the battery wam. If you have extra batteries... No problem. Has a good strong airflow, but is not an industrial machine. I like not having to use gas and pulling a rope and maintaining a gas unit. I use the blower function only and not the mulching feature.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Cutrell

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT BLOWER - BUY THIS ONE
customer_reviews.text: Works on all types of debris. Love the shape of the blower nozzle. Am able to control the direction of the debris much easier than the big round hole end types like my husbands. I use it a lot around my pool. The lowest speed works to get rid of pine straw and those little propeller type seeds that fall. My husbands blower doesn't compare to this. Would recommend this for everyone. Powerful as you could possibly need. I haven't even tried the suction sweeper yet. but I am sure it will be great. Soon as I do, I will let you know. And the battery I bought holds the charge for several days use.
customer_reviews.author: M Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Sucks up the leaves and mulches them great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Sucks up the leaves and mulches them great. NO Cords! No gas pull starts and refueling. Battery lasts ok on full charge, enough to work for 30-40 minutes maybe. Keep clogging with wet leaves though. have to stop several times to clean out blades... Handle positions help a lot with holding and carrying but it does get heavy with a full load of leaves. Works way better than my corded mulcher blower...
customer_reviews.author: Leon Qubick

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for a gas blower.
customer_reviews.text: Nearly as powerful as my gas blower and works great for grass and leaves. Also works much better than expected as a leaf vacuum. Plenty of battery life to clean up after mowing my 1/2 acre yard. Will probably get an extra battery for fall leaf cleanup because running as a vacuum it doesn't last quite long enough to get the whole job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful without the fumes!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for weekly porch and driveway clean up. Works perfectly and easily stores inside the house instead of inside the garage. Have not tried it with heavy leaves for blowing or vacuum option, but am happy so far! Now have 4 devices that work off the same battery packs.
customer_reviews.author: DSW

customer_reviews.title: The speed controls are set up excellent. The only down side is that the on/off ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my older, and broken Toro blower/vac with this model. Not only is it quieter, but it is much more versatile. The speed controls are set up excellent. The only down side is that the on/off buttons are a little difficult to use if you are wearing gloves of any significance, i.e., leather or heavy canvas. Otherwise, a solid thumbs up on this blower!
customer_reviews.author: Tim's Choice

customer_reviews.title: Sure beats raking!
customer_reviews.text: This is surprisingly powerful. We already had other products using same battery including the older single speed non-bagging version; so we were somewhat locked into the Greenworx line. it handled wet maple leaves this fall even on lower setting. The previous single speed version lasted 3 years. Haven't tried the bagger function.
customer_reviews.author: D and K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool without hassle
customer_reviews.text: I own a Greenworks Trimmer, chain saw and now the blower. All are powered by the same battery pack, start without a problem (no more frustrating pulling starter strings to get the motor started or fuel issues), the trimmer string is easy to replace and the blower is great. These products are wonderful for women who want to just push a button and have the tool start to work. Being cordless is a must on a large piece of property and the battery lasts long enough to do a job well. I absolutely love these products and will purchase other attachments.
customer_reviews.author: traveler33

customer_reviews.title: Its green!
customer_reviews.text: Like the weight and like that it uses the same battery as my mower Dont like that it goes through power quickly and the air power isnt as strong as I would expect... Its also fairly high priced and a premium to keep the same battery as mentuoned above
customer_reviews.author: L5 Productions

customer_reviews.title: Broken blower and time and effort to replace it
customer_reviews.text: This blower worked for 2 years and then it would not turn on. The push buttons did not power the machine on. Took it to the authorized dealer in town who after 5 days they called to advise it could not be fixed and Green works would send a new one. There was no confirmation that one was being sent. We called Greenworks and they had nothing on file to send a new blower to us. After 4 or 5 phone calls they advised it would be 3 weeks before we would received the blower. It has arrived.
customer_reviews.author: David Maffey

customer_reviews.title: If only it had started
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on the good reviews. Was eager to augment my compost with a good dose of mulched maple leaves. Unfortunately the device wouldn't start. I called Support as several people here have suggested and waited over 1.5 hours to have someone tell me it's defective and send it back. Also noticed on the box the battery lasts only 15 minutes on high. C'mon, my Ego mower will run for nearly my half acre lot.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Sy

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until the power button didn't work anymore. Second Greenworks product to fail.
customer_reviews.text: This blower/leaf vac worked great until the power button stopped working. No response from Greenworks to emails or phone calls. I have 6 Greenworks products. 2 have failed. 1 battery died withing the first 6 months. Dang it. I wish I would have stuck to products from real companies!!! Just waiting for the rest to fail so I can recycle the lot.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hoff

customer_reviews.title: Lot's of power
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of use, the variable speed is nice for working around delicate plants or places you don't want to kick up to much dust. a bit heavy, but in the past I used a corded electric blower because I thought battery operated wouldn't have he power, but this has plenty of power. I did get the 4.0 battery and it last a long time and charges quickly. I would recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blown away
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic,saves this old lady a lot of hard labor. arrived a day early,has good power, the day I got it was after a hard rain and my leaves were deep and wet,I got about 45 min. battery life on high setting, in the days after as the leaves dried out I had only to use half speed and occasional bursts to loosen wetter spots,got more battery life on the lower setting. Haven't used the bagger mulcher feature just yet ,but will update when I do. overall I'm very happy with this purchase. Light weight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: shelle Iles

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is top notch!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bag has a bit of back blow but I'm blowing or sucking dirt and leaves either way. Vacuuming does well on dried leaves, if they are moist you'll need to clean the end often. Point being don't wait until the end of summer to suck them all at once!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Battery is heavier, but lasts longer, than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: The blower/vacuum works as described. I haven't yet used the vacuum, but I doubt I will be disappointed. I live in a forest, and am about to get slammed with fall leaves like I've never seen before. I think this blower will be able to keep up. It will be good that I can just blow the leaves back into the woods, and no one will care. Then nature can work at natural decomposition. No bagging or lugging.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Overall both the blower and vacuum functions work pretty well. Just make sure to read the fine print about the battery life, "60 minutes on low". On the low setting both functions (blower/vacuum) are pretty useless, when on the highest setting everything works pretty well for about 30 minutes. I am considering buying a second battery, although the batteries by themselves are almost as expensive as the product they are powering, I may just wait until I need another tool.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Bort

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly loud when using as a mulcher/vacuum
customer_reviews.text: After setting it up as a mulcher, I tested it, and it's very loud. You have to set it to "High" to use as a mulcher/vacuum, and the manual says, you must wear hearing protection. Of course, that is a separate charge. It's too bad that it won't vacuum except on the turbo-setting. I don't understand how they can say it has low noise, when it's right next to your waist, and this extreme volume level.
customer_reviews.author: Jadwin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: We've had this a few months now & love it. It actually will blow wet leaves from around our pond and yard which was the whole purpose for buying it. Haven't tried the vac part so no opinion on that. I like that the batter will also operate the trimmer we got as well. So far we're satisfied with Greenworks products.
customer_reviews.author: lori

customer_reviews.title: light weight
customer_reviews.text: I decided to do some last minute trimming and blowing before the rain moved in and was a little worried about the Green works blower having enough power to blow damp leaves but it worked great and no extension cords to drag through the bushes I am trimming. I am so happy with all of my Green works tools!
customer_reviews.author: snowhappy

customer_reviews.title: Works good, worth the money
customer_reviews.text: People amaze me, they talk bad about this battery powered blower saying that it isn't as powerful as their old gas powered one. You my friend are a genius, of course it isn't, and if you thought it would be you probably shouldn't be allowed to reproduce. For clearing the driveway of grass clippings, leaves etc., this thing works like a champ. Easy to use, no fuss, not crazy loud, very convenient. If you own a farm or a lot of land, don't get this, buy a gas powered one and be happy.
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: I really like this. It's exactly what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. It's exactly what I hoped for. Lots of huge (50') liquid amber trees in school ground next door that shower our house and patio with leaves. Have a highly rated black and decker electric model but sick of getting out the extension cord and putting it away when done. I use this for ~10 minutes at a time, charge seems to be lasting 3-4 uses. Very convenient for my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: richard j. case

customer_reviews.title: Does the job - but you need to work quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Good for simple yard cleanup, but the battery drains really quickly. Using power setting 5 or 6 (out of 6 max), I find that I only get about 20-25 minutes of use. I wanted the convenience of cordless over the power/longevity of corded, but I wasn't expecting it to die quite this fast. For the short period of time it does run, the blower and vacuum both work fine with most jobs, but the vacuum has struggled a little bit with mulching thicker magnolia tree leaves - it gets stuffed up, so I have to turn it off periodically to shake the leaves out of the fan, and then try again with fewer leaves at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two stars for blowing power. Everything else about this unit is awful.
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are correct: the vacuum function is inefficient, awkward, and EXTREMELY dusty. I tried making a "gasket" around the intake with gorilla tape and that did improve the dust leak there, only to emphasize how much dust comes out of the bag vent holes. I also HATE that the battery clips into the charger, these batteries are so heavy there is no concern about falling out. There should be a ejector spring on the batteries like Black & Decker.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lutz

customer_reviews.title: Clogs easily, ultra-dusty, good idea, bead execution
customer_reviews.text: POV of this review is from he vacuum function only. I was hoping the negative reviews were inaccurate.. they were not. We have a small backyard and had high hopes for this tool. After only a few short minutes of use did I realize it was likely not going to impressed. When working with larger 'crispy' fig tree leaves it jammed up multiple times which led to you shutting off the power and a big mess of debris tubing out onto the ground. The other reviews about it being a dust storm producer were spot on. Do your self a favor and avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Works Well While It Lasts:
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a battery operated blower/mulcher like this. The only regret is the battery lasts about 15 to 20 minutes. And the batteries are expensive. The blower is adequate with driveway and sidewalks with dry leaves. On the grass, the leaves are harder to blow even in full mode. Be warned that when mulching be prepared to dusted from head to toe. The tiny particles that blow through the catch bag create a dust cloud. Consider a mask if your lungs are sensitive. Overall, however, for small house jobs I love the way I can quickly snap in the battery, blow leaves and such, and put it away easily. Hopefully, the battery technology will improve in time.
customer_reviews.author: kwmccarthy

customer_reviews.title: BEAST !
customer_reviews.text: BEAST ! Have always used Shindaiwa equipment and they work great, but my blower is the only piece that has given me trouble, twice. Instead of spending the money on repair I bought this Greenworks blower and it works better than the gas powered Shindaiwa ever did ! Greenworks is pretty good stuff, love the pole saw I have ! If you are tired of gas powered gear, look hard at Greenworks G-Max gear, batteries work in all kinds of tools and have plenty of power, last a good long time, recharge quickly. Very happy with this purchase !
customer_reviews.author: Keith Brown

customer_reviews.title: Lasts about a month
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second Greenworks blower after having the first replaced under the warranty after a little over a month of use. The problem is the power switch, which after only a few uses becomes more frustrating, requiring more pressure and more attempts before the blower starts. After a few more uses, the blower will not start at all. Warranty replacement took nearly 6 weeks last time. I'm going to try again, but I don't understand why this obvious flaw is not fixed.
customer_reviews.author: JPFFF

customer_reviews.title: Not bad -- could use a bit more power but it does blow grass clippings pretty well
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've only used it twice but it works for blowing grass clippings. Not as strong as my old gas powered blower attachment, but it does the job -- you just need to take a bit more time to get everything. I bought this after the blower attachment for my GreenWorks power head didn't work. It would shut off at high speed but worked at low speed. This works at all speeds, but it could use a bit more power.
customer_reviews.author: vdawg

customer_reviews.title: When the work they are good. I had problems right away with two of ...
customer_reviews.text: When the work they are good. I had problems right away with two of them. one of them with the switch I had to take it in for repair. Repair shop sent it back to Greenworks and they replaced it. 2nd one had problems right away with the vac. Greenworks replaced it because the button on the vac. connection was poorly designed. The replacement is 3 times more sturdy,larger and redesigned. I have about 5 Greenwork tools and they all work very well-except the vac. Greenworks support had no problem making things right. -
customer_reviews.author: G. Geagan

customer_reviews.title: Great Leaf Blower
customer_reviews.text: I have the weed eater and lawn mower so I already had two batteries and charger. I got this to clean off the driveway and sidewalks, and it works great for those jobs. You can adjust the speed and change it from a blower to allow it to suck up the leaves into the bag. It has held up well with heavy use, and it is light weight enough that my son will use it.
customer_reviews.author: S Crow

product_meta.title: Greenworks 40V 185 MPH Variable Speed Cordless Leaf Blower/Vacuum, 4.0Ah Battery and Charger Included 24322
product_meta.description:
Style:4.0Ah Battery and Charger Included| Pattern Name:ToolGreenWorks DigiPro Brushless Series delivers a powerful solution to rival gas powered tools. Easy to use, powerful brushless motor and lower operating cost, this DigiPro Variable Speed G-MAX Blower/Vac offers versatile features and a zero emissions solution for cleaning and clearing debris. The innovative brushless motor technology provides up to 80% longer life, less noise and lower vibration for user comfort. With up to 185 mph wind speed, 340 CFM, light weight, ergonomic design and vacuum capability, this tool gets the job done without the hassle and mess of gas powered blowers--simply snap in the battery and start working. Compatible with our GreenWorks G-MAX system, you can work on clearing your yard and collecting up to 4.5 bags of debris on a single charge using the G-MAX 40V 4.0 ah battery sold separately. Only compatible with GreenWorks G-MAX 40V Batteries Models 29462, 29472 and Charger Model 29482. On the bottom of the blower there is a gate / cover that protects the user from getting into the spinning impeller of the blower. In order to use the blower as a Vac, this gate is opened and a collection tube is inserted to allow for leaf pick. There is a safety switch on this gate and if the gate becomes unlatched during use as a blower, it will not allow the blower to run. Please ask the customer to check to assure that the gate is securely latched and try the battery again.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The DigiPro Brushless G-MAX Series provides the gas comparable power without the gas. That means no more trips to the gas stations, winterizing of tools or hazardous fumes while you work. Currently featuring the DigiPro 16" Chainsaw, DigiPro 185MPH Blower/Vac and now the 14" String Trimmer, you don't have to sacrifice power to go cordless. The DigiPro Blower/Vac features versatile features and a zero emission solution for cleaning and clearing debris. The innovative brushless motor technology provides up to 80% longer life and up to 30% more torque, it also creates less noise and lower vibration for user comfort. The variable speed dial allows you to regulate your wind speed for the best directional control and combined with a turbo button to offer up to 185 mph wind speed. The 340 CFM, light weight, ergonomic design and vacuum capability makes your clean up chore a breeze--simply snap in the battery, press a button and you are ready to go. No more hard to manage pull cords, mixing oil and gas, and heavy tools, start enjoying the your weekend in your yard without the fumes and hassle with the DigiPro Blower/Vac. Available with a G-MAX 40V 4ah Li-Ion Battery or Tool Only, the G-MAX System is compatible with 14 different lawn tools to offer a complete yard care solution for the serious lawn care home owner. When looking for the right gas comparable lawn tools, GreenWorks G-MAX System is the right solution to turn to with the power and performance, longer run time and versatility to get the job done.
feature_bullets: Brushless motor provides your tool with longer run-time, more torque and more power.  This leads to less wear and tear, extending the life-time of the tool
Variable speed offers up to 185 mph to make clean up of major debris easy and efficient.No-Load Speed (RPM). Ideal For - 1/4 Acre
Blower/Vac capability provides a versatile use to get your yard work done without the need for multiple tools
Powerful enough to handle wet and dry leaves
Compatible ONLY with GreenWorks G-MAX 40V Battery models, 29472 and 29462 and G-MAX Charger model 29482.Note: 40V G-MAX and 40V Lithium-Ion Batteries are not cross compatible

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,901 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
